header.gameNote: MEN WHO SPEAK UP MAIN EVENT

article.description: Isaiah Zierden made five 3-pointers and finished with a career-high 24 points, and Creighton rolled to a 103-78 victory over UTSA on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Zierden with 24 points, Creighton beats UTSA 103-78
article.linkText: Zierden with 24 points, Creighton beats UTSA 103-78
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. -- Isaiah Zierden made five 3-pointers and finished with a career-high 24 points, and Creighton rolled to a 103-78 victory over UTSA on Tuesday night. Zierden was 7 of 13 from the floor and had four assists. Cole Huff scored 17 points on 6-of-9 shooting, and James Milliken added 12 points for the Blue Jays (2-0). Ryan Bowie had 23 points and 10 rebounds to lead UTSA (0-3). Gino Littles scored 16 points on 5-of-9 shooting and had five assists, and Nick Allen added 11 points for the Roadrunners. Zierden scored 12 points in the first half and Creighton led 61-37 at halftime. The Blue Jays tied a CenturyLink Center Omaha record with 61 first-half points. The Blue Jays stretched their lead to 32 points midway through the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
